name: Privacy Violations
description: We work to safeguard personal identity and information. We remove content that shares, offers or solicits personally identifiable information or other private information that could lead to physical or financial harm, including financial, residential, and medical information, as well as private information obtained from illegal sources.

categories.name: Personally Identifiable Information (PII)
categories.description: Information that uniquely identifies an individual

subcategories.name: PII of Poster
subcategories.description: Content sharing PII of the person posting
examples: Here's my social security number: XXX-XX-XXXX

subcategories.name: PII of Others
subcategories.description: Content sharing PII of other people

subcategories.name: Asking for PII
subcategories.description: Content requesting PII of others
examples: I need your driver's license info

categories.name: Personal Contact Information
categories.description: Personal phone numbers and email addresses

subcategories.name: Sharing Contact Info of Others
subcategories.description: Sharing personal contact information of others without consent

subcategories.name: Sharing for Charitable/Missing Persons
subcategories.description: Contact info shared for charitable causes, finding missing people/animals, or business contact
examples: If you find this missing dog, call 555-1234
conditions: Charitable purpose OR missing persons/animals OR business contact

subcategories.name: Public Contact Information
subcategories.description: Contact information made public by the individual

subcategories.name: Asking for Own Contact Info
subcategories.description: Asking others for their own contact information
examples: Can you give me your phone number?
conditions: Asking for person's own contact info

subcategories.name: Asking for Third Party Contact Info
subcategories.description: Asking for contact information of third parties
conditions: Asking for third party contact info

categories.name: Residential Information
categories.description: Private residential addresses and safe house information

subcategories.name: Full Private Residential Address
subcategories.description: Sharing complete private residential addresses including building name or map pins
examples: She lives at 123 Main Street, Apt 4B, City
His address is [full address with map pin]
conditions: Not official residence of high-ranking official

subcategories.name: Full Address for Charitable/Missing Persons
subcategories.description: Full address shared for charitable causes or finding missing people/animals
conditions: Charitable purpose OR missing persons/animals OR business

subcategories.name: Official Residence of Public Official
subcategories.description: Official residence or embassy of high-ranking public official

subcategories.name: Partial Address in Protest/Surveillance Context
subcategories.description: Partial address shared in context of organizing protests or surveillance
examples: Let's protest at their house on Oak Street
They live in [neighborhood], let's go there
[Map pin] - meet here to watch their house
conditions: Street OR city<50k OR postal code OR map pin

subcategories.name: Imagery of Private Residence
subcategories.description: External imagery of private residence with identifying information when resident objects
conditions: Single-family home OR unit number identified
Not focus of news story (unless protest context)

subcategories.name: Asking for Residential Information
subcategories.description: Requesting private residential information of others
examples: Can someone tell me where they live?
conditions: Not official residence of high-ranking official

subcategories.name: Safe House Information
subcategories.description: Exposing information about safe houses
examples: Here's an image of the safe house
The residents of the safe house are [names]
conditions: Safe house not actively promoting its facility

subcategories.name: Personal Financial Information
subcategories.description: Non-public financial records, bank accounts with security codes, payment info with login details, credit/debit card info with security codes
examples: His bank account is XXXX with PIN 1234
Her credit card number is XXXX exp XX/XX CVV XXX
Here are their non-public financial records

subcategories.name: Business Financial Information
subcategories.description: Non-public financial information of business organizations

categories.name: Medical Information
categories.description: Medical, psychological, biometric, or genetic/hereditary information from official sources

subcategories.name: Medical Records of Others
subcategories.description: Sharing or asking for medical information from official medical records
examples: Here's John's medical records showing his HIV status
conditions: From medical records or official documents

categories.name: Information from Hacked Sources
categories.description: Content from hacked sources regardless of target being public or private figure

subcategories.name: Hacked Content
subcategories.description: Content claimed or confirmed to come from hacked sources
examples: Got this from hacking their account
conditions: Poster claims content is hacked OR confirmed from hacked source

categories.name: Personal Attributes
categories.description: Sharing, asking for, or implying knowledge of personal attributes

subcategories.name: Sharing/Asking for Personal Attributes
subcategories.description: Content sharing or asking for personal attributes of a user or user's family (on-platform only)
conditions: Shares or asks for personal attributes

subcategories.name: Mentioning/Referencing Attributes
subcategories.description: Content mentioning or referencing personal attributes without sharing, asking for, or implying knowledge
examples: Services to clean up criminal records

categories.name: Implying Knowledge of Private Information
categories.description: Content implying knowledge of private information or personal attributes (on-platform only)

subcategories.name: Implying Knowledge of PII
subcategories.description: Content implying knowledge of user's PII
examples: Your credit card number ending in 7528 has been compromised
Does your social security number begin with 638?

subcategories.name: Implying Knowledge of Financial Info
subcategories.description: Content implying knowledge of user's financial information or vulnerable financial status
examples: Welfare checks not covering your expenses?
You are bankrupt... but don't worry
Rebuild your low credit score today!
Are you unemployed and in need of cash?

subcategories.name: Implying Knowledge of Medical Info
subcategories.description: Content implying knowledge of user's medical information from official records
examples: Use this medication to treat symptoms of your arthritis
Don't skip this video if you're suffering from depression

subcategories.name: Implying Knowledge of Personal Attributes
subcategories.description: Content implying knowledge of user's personal attributes
examples: Are you between 18-25 years of age?
Are you a man living in...?
If your name is Peter, then you are eligible

subcategories.name: Implying Knowledge of Voting Status
subcategories.description: Content implying knowledge of user's voting history or registration
examples: Your vote has not been counted
Records show you haven't requested a ballot
Official records show your voter registration is incomplete
Public data indicates you voted in 2018, but not 2015

subcategories.name: Health-Related PSA
subcategories.description: Health PSA with direct/conditional questions (allowed exception)
examples: Want to understand your cancer diagnosis?
If you're worried about your symptoms, go see your doctor

labelHierarchy.label: Privacy > PII, Contact or Residential Information

exceptions.name: Publicly Available Information
exceptions.description: Information already publicly available through legitimate sources (5+ news outlets, court records, press releases, professional licenses, sex offender registries). Does NOT include data broker sites, deeds, real estate listings, police reports
exceptions.note: Does NOT apply to residential information policy

exceptions.name: Private Messages
exceptions.description: Sharing or asking for private information in private messages

exceptions.name: Fictional Characters
exceptions.description: Private information belonging to fictional characters from books, movies, etc.

exceptions.name: Charitable Causes / Missing Persons
exceptions.description: Contact info or addresses shared to promote charitable causes, facilitate finding missing people/animals, or contact business/service providers

exceptions.name: Official Residence of High-Ranking Public Official
exceptions.description: Official publicly-owned residences provided to heads of state, government ministers, governors, mayors, ambassadors, consuls, and other high-ranking officials

exceptions.name: Public Business Financial Information
exceptions.description: Business financial info shared by organization itself or through public reporting requirements (stock exchange filings, regulatory agencies)

exceptions.name: Generic Attribute Mentions
exceptions.description: Mentioning attributes without implying knowledge of specific users (e.g., 'Meet seniors', 'Gay dating online')

exceptions.name: Health-Related PSA
exceptions.description: Public Service Announcements about health issues using direct or conditional questions

exceptions.name: Voting Encouragement
exceptions.description: Generic voting encouragement without implying knowledge of specific user's voting status

exceptions.name: Financial Educational Content
exceptions.description: Generic financial education without implying knowledge of user's financial status

exceptions.name: Items Not Considered PII
exceptions.description: Student ID numbers, boarding passes, photos without ID numbers

exceptions.name: Generic Business Emails
exceptions.description: Generic company emails (contact@, info@, help@) are not personal contact info

exceptions.name: Residence as News Story Focus
exceptions.description: Residence depicted because it's focus of news story (event, sale, value, court proceeding) - except protest context

glossary.pii: Personally Identifiable Information - information that uniquely identifies an individual including: national ID numbers, SSN, passport numbers, government IDs, civil registry records, immigration documents, driver's licenses, license plates, digital identity passwords
glossary.personal_contact_info: Personal phone numbers, personal and work email addresses. Social media handles are NOT personal contact info. Generic company emails (contact@, info@, help@) are NOT personal contact info
glossary.personal_attributes: Age, criminal record, ethnicity, financial attributes, gender identity, health attributes, membership in trade union, name, race, religious identity, religious affiliation, sexual orientation, voting status
glossary.financial_attributes: Information describing vulnerable financial status: public benefits/welfare, bankruptcy, bad credit scores, unemployment status
glossary.health_attributes: Information describing health status including mental health, illnesses, disability, medical conditions
glossary.medical_conditions: Serious disease, illness, injury, genetic/congenital defect, or biological/psychological condition outside normal age-appropriate variation. Includes miscarriage, stillbirth, pregnancy complications. Does NOT include common cold, sore throat, minor cuts
glossary.safe_house: Temporary residence offering support to vulnerable people - women's, refugees', witness protection, asylum-seekers' safe houses
glossary.hacked_vs_leaked: Hacked = intentionally accessed digital data without authorization. Leaked = shared with third party without permission by someone with valid access
glossary.publicly_available: Info from: 5+ news outlets, organization's own financial disclosures, court records (unless sealed), professional/business licenses, sex offender registries, government press releases. NOT: data brokers, deeds, real estate listings, police reports
glossary.implying_knowledge: Suggesting or hinting at topics/concepts related to user without explicitly stating - typically with indirect language, hints, implicit cues. In paid content, perceived as advertiser having user information
glossary.criminal_record: Information about crimes person has allegedly or actually committed
glossary.voting_status: Voting history, registration status, how/if they voted, voting process (absentee vs polling)
glossary.trade_union: Legal entity of employees with common interest
glossary.gender_identity: Person's concept of self as male, female, combination, or neither - can differ from sex assigned at birth
glossary.sexual_orientation: Sexual identity in relation to gender attracted to: heterosexual, homosexual, bisexual, etc.
glossary.ethnicity: People identifying with each other based on common ancestral, social, cultural, or national experience
glossary.single_family_home: Residence with own identifiable front door/gate, OR takes up entire stand-alone building, OR unit singled out as belonging to specific person/family

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: Follow order of labels in UDT: Hacked Sources > PII/Contact/Residential > Financial > Medical > Personal Attributes
operationalGuidelines.indicator_requirement: 1 primary indicator + 1 secondary indicator = violating (unless specified otherwise)
operationalGuidelines.name_face_match: Required to establish that person is the affected party
operationalGuidelines.consent_indicators: Lack of consent: affected person objects OR reports content. Consent: assumption of familiarity, claim of consent on behalf of person
operationalGuidelines.identity_document_rule: Violating image needs: identifiable name + ID number (unless ID belongs to public figure or easily identifiable person)
operationalGuidelines.pii_of_dead: Still violating - can lead to identity theft
operationalGuidelines.condemnation_exception: Does NOT apply to PII - sharing PII can cause harm regardless of intent
operationalGuidelines.aggregated_info: Multiple sources aggregated on platform is NOT 'publicly available'
operationalGuidelines.news_published_info: Info from non-public sources published by news outlets = publicly available
operationalGuidelines.residential_city_threshold: City/neighborhood only counts as identifier if <50,000 residents
operationalGuidelines.protest_context: Stricter rules apply - even partial address with any identifier is violating
